newsitem.title: USA: Snyder sees Q3 $4.7 mln charge for dry hole.
newsitem.headline: Snyder sees Q3 $4.7 mln charge for dry hole.

text.p: Snyder Oil Corp said Thursday it expects a third quarter charge of about $4.7 million for a non-productive well in the eastern Gulf of Mexico.
The charge, for the company's Main Pass 248 1 well, an exploratory test, will be to exploration expense.
The company said its Viosca Knoll 698 A-4 development well was recently drilled and completed as a successful producer.
"While we are disappointed with the result of our most recent exploratory well, we remain pleased with our overall Gulf of Mexico drilling program." said Chairman John Snyder.

"From inception to date, we have completed 14 out of 15 development wells and two out of four exploratory wells as successful producers. That represents a 93 percent success ratio on development and 50 percent on exploration. We remain on schedule to install our Main Pass 261 platform in our Ingrid Field and to commence production from that new field discovery in the first half of 1998."

Snyder said the recent gathering and transportation arrangements between it and an affiliate of Williams Cos and with Viosca Knoll Gathering Co will enable it to post substantial 1998 production volume and cash flow increases.
